meanings.definition: To cut off or remove the side shoots or branches from (a tree or shrub).
meanings.sent1: I sned the branches from the tree to help it grow better.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will sned the shrub to make it look neat.
meanings.sent3: The tree asked me to sned its branches so it could dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: With each sned, the tree seemed to breathe a sigh of relief.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sned echoed through the forest, signaling a fresh start.

meanings.definition: A cutting or trimming of side shoots or branches from a tree or shrub.
meanings.sent1: After the sned, the tree looked more balanced and healthy.
meanings.sent2: She collected the sned branches to use as firewood.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the sned as a cozy shelter during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The sned pile grew taller, resembling a miniature forest.
meanings.sent5: The sned was a gift to the garden, clearing space for new growth.
